name.title: The name of the ETL integration. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the ETL integration. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A phrase describing the objective of the ETL data integration.
description.description: A phrase describing the high-level objective of the ETL. A reference to data source and format is especially useful.

name.title: The name of the ETL source. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: A description of the ETL source.
description.description: A phrase describing the source component of the ETL. Think about describing the what/where of this data source.

start.title: Start time to check the ETL source for updates.
start.description: Specify the start time to check the ETL source for updates. This is a 'speak-friendly' phrase that comprises the trigger time as well as the frequency. Translated into a cron expression.

retry.title: Retry policy applying to the ETL source updates.
retry.description: This outlines the retry configuration in the case of ETL engine being unable to connect to the ETL data source. Includes limit and delay before retry.

runOnStartup.title: Check the ETL source for updates at appliation startup.
runOnStartup.description: Specify here whether the ETL source is checked for updates when the application starts.

schedule.title: Scheduling of the ETL source.
schedule.description: Specify when and how frequently the ETL source is checked for updates, as well as the retry policy in case of failure. Includes a switch to indicate whether update is triggered at application startup.

dataConnectionName.title: The name of the integration source. Contains no spaces.
dataConnectionName.description: The name of the data connection for this integration source. This must refer to an existing data connection in infrastructure, dependencies, dataConnections.

items.title: Column(s) in datetime format used for watermark purpose.
items.description: List datetime columns to be compared to target data to indicate if data has changed.

dateColumns.title: Column(s) in datetime format used for watermark purpose.
dateColumns.description: List datetime columns to be compared to target data to indicate if data has changed.

sequentialKeyColumn.title: Sequential key column used for watermark purpose.
sequentialKeyColumn.description: Specify a sequential key columns to be compared to target data to indicate if data has changed.

watermark.title: Definition namespace for watermark columns on the ETL source data.
watermark.description: This section lists the column(s) on the source data used to compare to the target data to indicate whether the source data has been updated.

query.title: The query to execute.
query.description: The query that will be executed on the source database.

minimumExpectedRecords.title: The minimum expected record count.
minimumExpectedRecords.description: The minimum expected record count as a result of this data ingestion.

databaseOptions.title: Definition namespace for a database ETL source.
databaseOptions.description: This section specified attributes related to an ETL source of type Database. Attributes include the database query as well as minimumexpected records.

filename.title: The file name.
filename.description: The name of the file that will be ingested.

minimumExpectedRecords.title: The minimum expected record count.
minimumExpectedRecords.description: The minimum expected record count as a result of this data ingestion.

fileOptions.title: Definition namespace for a file type ETL source.
fileOptions.description: This section specified attributes related to an ETL source of type File. Attributes include the database query as well as minimumexpected records.

sourceName.title: The source name.
sourceName.description: The name of the queue or topic subscription from which messages will be consumed.

messageQueueOptions.title: Definition namespace for a Message Queue ETL source.
messageQueueOptions.description: This section specified attributes related to an ETL source of type Message Queue. Attributes include the route, format and verb.

route.title: The path component for the request URI.
route.description: The path component for the request URI, e.g. '/myPath' in http://localhost:8081/myPath?myParameter=123.

responseFormat.title: The Http response format.
responseFormat.description: The format of the Http response data papyload, eg. Json, XML.

httpVerb.title: The Http request verb.
httpVerb.description: The relevant verb detailing the Http request type, i.e. GET, POST, etc.

webApiOptions.title: Definition namespace for a web API ETL source.
webApiOptions.description: This section specified attributes related to an ETL source of type web API. Attributes include the route, response format and http verb.

source.title: Definition namespace for attributes describing the source component of an ETL integration.
source.description: This section details ETL source attributes like name, description, scheduling and watermark specifications.

sourceColumn.title: Column name to be mapped at the ETL data source.
sourceColumn.description: Specifies the source column to be mapped during the ETL transform.

converter.title: Specify case conversion during source to target transform.
converter.description: Specifies whether any case conversion is performed during the ETL transform. Source data may be converted to lowercase or uppercase for example.

targetAttribute.title: Target attribute to which source column is to be mapped.
targetAttribute.description: Specifies the name of the target attribute to to which the source column is mapped during the ETL transform.

items.title: Source to target column mappings details of the ETL transform component.
items.description: Specifies one or more column mappings between source and target in an ETL data integration.

mappings.title: Source to target column mappings details of the ETL transform component.
mappings.description: Specifies one or more column mappings between source and target in an ETL data integration.

sourceColumn.title: Source column used as key for lookup.
sourceColumn.description: Specify the source column of which the content will serve as the key for the lookup.

table.title: Name of the lookup table.
table.description: Specify the table name used for the lookup at the data source.

lookupColumn.title: Name of the lookup column.
lookupColumn.description: Specify the column used for the lookup at the data source.

returnColumn.title: Name of the column used for the return value.
returnColumn.description: Specify the return column of which the value is used for the lookup result.

match.title: Attributes related to source table used for the lookup.
match.description: Specify information about the source lookup table. This includes table name, lookup column and return column.

targetAttribute.title: Target attribute for lookup result.
targetAttribute.description: Specify the name of the target attribute to which the lookup result will be persisted.

items.title: Details of lookups performed during the ETL transform component.
items.description: Specifies information related to lookups during the ETL transform. Attributes include source columns and target attributes, as well as match directives like lookup table and column and return column name.

lookups.title: Details of lookups performed during the ETL transform component.
lookups.description: Specifies information related to lookups during the ETL transform. Attributes include source columns and target attributes, as well as match directives like lookup table and column and return column name.

transform.title: Definition namespace for attributes describing the transform component of an ETL integration.
transform.description: This section details ETL transform attributes like field mapping and value lookups.

name.title: The name of the ETL target. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the ETL target. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: The description of the ETL target.
description.description: A phrase describing the ETL target.

targetType.title: The type of target.
targetType.description: Specify the type of target. Options include entity, database, file, webAPI and message queue.

dataConnectionName.title: The name of the ETL target data connection. Contains no spaces.
dataConnectionName.description: The name should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

storedProcedure.title: The stored procedure to execute.
storedProcedure.description: The stored procedure that will be executed on the target database.

filename.title: The file name.
filename.description: The name of the file that will be created.

targetName.title: The target name.
targetName.description: The name of the queue, topic or subscription to which messages will be sent.

target.title: Definition namespace for attributes describing the target component of an ETL integration.
target.description: This section details ETL target attributes like name, description and type among other.

items.title: The definition namespace for application ETL data integrations.
items.description: One or more solution data integrations with common ETL attributes including source, transform and target.

integrations.title: The definition namespace for application ETL data integrations.
integrations.description: One or more solution data integrations with common ETL attributes including source, transform and target.

name.title: The name of the DTO. Contains no spaces.
name.description: The name of the DTO. It should be a commonly used singular noun and be unique within a solution.

description.title: The description of the DTO.
description.description: A phrase describing the DTO and what it represents in the real world.

name.title: The name of the attribute. Contains no spaces.
name.description: Assign a descriptive name to the attribute. Should be a singular noun and be unique within a collection of attributes. PascalCase recommended.

description.title: The description of the attribute.
description.description: A descriptive phrase that explains the nature and function of this attribute within a collection.

type.title: The Nox type of this attribute.
type.description: Select the Nox value object type that best represents this attribute and its functional requirements within the domain.

isRequired.title: Is the attribute required? Boolean value.
isRequired.description: Indicates whether this attribute is required within the collection. Defaults to false.

label.title: A descriptive label for this attribute on the user interface.
label.description: The text label rendered on the user interface alongside the NoxTextInput component.

translationId.title: The multi-language translation identifier.
translationId.description: A unique string/key to reference the translations for this attribute for multi-language translations.

widget.title: Widget used to render this attribute on the user interface.
widget.description: The user interface control type that is best suited to render the attribute on the screen.

icon.title: The icon representing the attribute on the user interface.
icon.description: A reference URI to the attribute icon file. Could be a CSS or Mudblazor reference, e.g. '@Icons.Material.Filled.Globe'.

iconPosition.title: The position of the attribute icon on the user interface.
iconPosition.description: The postition of the attribute icon relative to the text input area on the user interface, e.g. begin or end.

inputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control text input.
inputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid input values. For example '(000) 000-0000' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

outputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control a value's output.
outputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid output. Used to handle validation triggers for onSubmit and onChange events of the control.

regex.title: The regular expression against which input is validated.
regex.description: A regex string that indicates the format of valid input. For example '/^(\([0-9]{3}\) |[0-9]{3}-)[0-9]{3}-[0-9]{4}$/gm' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

pageGroup.title: The user interface PageGroup identifier.
pageGroup.description: Used to associate component with a PageGroup identifier on the user interface.

fieldGroup.title: The user interface FieldGroup identifier.
fieldGroup.description: Used to associate component with a FieldGroup identifier on the user interface.

inputOrder.title: Display/edit focus order within a FieldGroup on a user interface.
inputOrder.description: The order within a group of user interface components (FieldGroup) in which this attribute will receive focus for display or edit purpose.

helpHint.title: Helper text for this component.
helpHint.description: The component default helper text used to aid the understanding of the component function to the user.

errorMessage.title: Validation error message.
errorMessage.description: The default error message displayed when text input validation fails.

userInterface.title: The user interface display options for this attribute.
userInterface.description: Specify how this attribute is rendered on the user interface. Configuration options include label, icon, input/output masks, help hints among other.

isReadonly.title: Is this attribute readonly? Boolean value.
isReadonly.description: Indicates whether this attribute is readonly. Defaults to false.

items.title: The attributes of which the DTO is comprised.
items.description: One or more attributes describing the composition of the DTO.

attributes.title: The attributes of which the DTO is comprised.
attributes.description: One or more attributes describing the composition of the DTO.

items.title: The definition namespace for application DTOs within a Nox solution.
items.description: One or more DTOs (Data Transfer Objects used to transfer data between processes in a Nox solution.

dataTransferObjects.title: The definition namespace for application DTOs within a Nox solution.
dataTransferObjects.description: One or more DTOs (Data Transfer Objects used to transfer data between processes in a Nox solution.

iconPosition.title: The position of the attribute icon on the user interface.
iconPosition.description: The postition of the attribute icon relative to the text input area on the user interface, e.g. begin or end.

inputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control text input.
inputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid input values. For example '(000) 000-0000' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

outputMask.title: A mask expression used to validate and control a value's output.
outputMask.description: A string of characters that indicates the format of valid output. Used to handle validation triggers for onSubmit and onChange events of the control.

regex.title: The regular expression against which input is validated.
regex.description: A regex string that indicates the format of valid input. For example '/^(\([0-9]{3}\) |[0-9]{3}-)[0-9]{3}-[0-9]{4}$/gm' could be used for a seven digit phone number with mandatory area code.

pageGroup.title: The user interface PageGroup identifier.
pageGroup.description: Used to associate component with a PageGroup identifier on the user interface.

fieldGroup.title: The user interface FieldGroup identifier.
fieldGroup.description: Used to associate component with a FieldGroup identifier on the user interface.

inputOrder.title: Display/edit focus order within a FieldGroup on a user interface.
inputOrder.description: The order within a group of user interface components (FieldGroup) in which this attribute will receive focus for display or edit purpose.

helpHint.title: Helper text for this component.
helpHint.description: The component default helper text used to aid the understanding of the component function to the user.

errorMessage.title: Validation error message.
errorMessage.description: The default error message displayed when text input validation fails.

userInterface.title: The user interface display options for this attribute.
userInterface.description: Specify how this attribute is rendered on the user interface. Configuration options include label, icon, input/output masks, help hints among other.

isReadonly.title: Is this attribute readonly? Boolean value.
isReadonly.description: Indicates whether this attribute is readonly. Defaults to false.

items.title: Definition namespace for Nox simple types.
items.description: Nox simple types definition used throughout Nox.Solution project.

arrayTypeOptions.title: Definition namespace for Nox simple types.
arrayTypeOptions.description: Nox simple types definition used throughout Nox.Solution project.

items.title: The events that this application can raise.
items.description: The collection of events that this application can raise to the outside world.

events.title: The events that this application can raise.
events.description: The collection of events that this application can raise to the outside world.

title: A definition for application components used in a Nox solution.
description: A definition for Integrations, DataTransferObjects and other pertinent components pertaining to a Nox solution application component.
